column2: Frequency: At least ten (10) working days prior to the commencement of cold planing operations.
Acceptance Criteria: Submission to Contract Administrator of a list of all plant and equipment to be used for the cold planing work.
1.02 - Proposal to Contract Administrator to texture, profile and mill in advance of asphalt overlay work in a work area closed to aircraft operations between work periods.
Frequency: Prior to the commencement of cold planing operations in the work area.
• Submission to Contract Administor of complete program and plan of texturing, profiling and milling and asphalt overlay work proposed in the work area.
1.03 - Proposal to Contract Administrator to texture, profile and mill in advance of asphalt overlay work in a work area open to aircraft operations between work periods.
Frequency: At least ten (10) working days prior to the commencement of cold planing operations in the work area.

• Submission to Contract Administrator of a proposal for a full scale demonstration to produce a textured surface safe for aircraft operations in that work area, date of the proposed demonstration, schedule and plan of texturing and asphalt overlay work proposed in the work area.

• Prior to the commencement of cold planing operations in each work period. Prior notice (60 minutes) of commencement time of cold planing plant verification process to be given to the Contract Administrator.
Acceptance Criteria: Verification that plant is in full working order and free from leaks of oil, hydraulic fluid, fuel and water.
Record of conformity: Plant verification checklist
• At the commencement of cold planing operations in each work period. Prior notice (30 minutes) of commencement time of cold planing to be given to the Contract Administrator.

• Verification that the machine cutters, forward speed and method of operation are removing asphalt to the required depth, producing the required surface texture and leaving a cold planed surface free of ridges.
• Prior to the commencement of cold planing operations in a work area that must be covered with asphalt before the end of the work period.

• Written notice to the Contract Administrator that all plant, equipment, labour, including that required for the placing, compaction and finishing of asphalt, are available and ready on-site and supply of asphalt for the work is confirmed even in the event of an unexpected breakdown of the asphalt mixing plant.
Frequency: Prior (48 hours) notice to the Contract Administrator of the commencement time of the texturing trial.
Acceptance Criteria: All resources required for the texturing trial are available and all arrangements required for the trial have been made.

• At the completion of texturing trial, prior to the commencement of application of tack coat and asphalt pavement at the trial area. Prior notice (30 minutes) of inspection to be given to the Contract Administrator.
• Construction of a trial section, comprising a single pass of the cold planing machine not less than 25m long, that incorporates all cold planing processes to be carried out during the work.
• Demonstration that the cold planing plant, operators and method proposed for texturing are capable of producing a suitable textured surface.
2.03 - Selection of textured surface reference area.
• At the completion of texturing trial, prior to the commencement of application of tack coat and asphalt pavement at the trial area.
• Prior notice (30 minutes) of inspection to be given to the Contract Administrator.
• Close up photographs framed at 300mm, incorporating a tape/ruler showing length.
• One direct overhead view and one view with camera resting on the surface pointing in the direction of the tooth cuts.
Record of conformity: Photos and typical measurements of the Texture Reference Area
3.01 - Removal of asphalt from the existing asphalt surface by texturing to required depth.
• At the completion of texturing in each work period and prior to the application of tack coat and asphalt paving.
• Prior notice (60 minutes minumum) of inspection to be given to the Contract Administrator.
Acceptance Criteria: Depth of asphalt removed not less than 7mm and not more than 12mm
3.02 - Removal of asphalt from the existing asphalt surface by texturing to achieve sufficiently coarse texture.
• At the completion of texturing in each work period and prior to the application of tack coat and asphalt paving.
• Prior notice (60 minutes minumum) of inspection to be given to the Contract Administrator.
– Transverse spacing of deepest tooth cuts is 45mm (±15mm)
– Longitudinal overlap of adjacent teeth of not more than 25% of the average length of two adjacent cuts
– Irregular surface between deepest tooth cuts; at least one point between cuts deviates >5mm from the deepest point.
3.03 - Removal of asphalt from the existing asphalt surface by texturing to achieve a uniform surface.
• At the completion of texturing in each work period and prior to the application of tack coat and asphalt paving.
• Prior notice (60 minutes minumum) of inspection to be given to the Contract Administrator.
• Texture is uniform, continuous without steps or abrupt changes in grade, free draining apart from water retained in cuts and breaks of textured surface.
• There are no visible grooves and all existing pavement markings have been completely removed.
• In the event that asphalt that is delaminated or exhibits evidence of delamination or lack of bond to the underlying layer is observed in the work area after texturing.
• All delaminated or debonded asphalt is profiled to a sufficient depth to remove all delaminated or poorly bonded asphalt, and patched with asphalt at least 40mm deep.
3.05 - Removal of cold planing and asphalt paving equipment from site.
• At the completion of texturing in areas open to aircraft operations between work periods, prior to the removal of cold planing and asphalt paving equipment from the work area.
• Absence of any possible deficiencies, delaminations, poor asphalt or any deficiency that may present a risk to aircraft.
Frequency: At the completion of texturing in areas open to aircraft operations between work periods.
Acceptance Criteria: All removed pavement marking is reinstated as shown on the Drawings and specified Section 7100.
4.01 - Removal of asphalt from existing asphalt surface by profiling to required depth.
• At the completion of profiling in each work period and prior to the application of tack coat and asphalt paving.
• Prior notice (60 minutes minimum) of inspection to be given to the Contract Administrator.
• Depth of asphalt removed not less than depth shown on Drawings and not more than depth shown on Drawings plus 10 mm.
4.02 - Removal of asphalt from existing asphalt surface by profiling to achieve a uniform surface.
• At the completion of profiling in each work period and prior to the application of tack coat and asphalt paving.
• Prior notice (60 minutes minimum) of inspection to be given to the Contract Administrator.
• Surface is uniform, continuous without steps or abrupt changes in grade except at steps and edges of work, and free draining.
• There are no visible grooves and all existing pavement markings have been completely removed.
4.03 - Removal of asphalt from existing asphalt surface to produce neat cut edges.
• At the completion of profiling in each work period and prior to the application of tack coat and asphalt paving.
• Prior notice (60 minutes minimum) of inspection to be given to the Contract Administrator.
Acceptance Criteria: Edges of cut are clean, not frayed and asphalt layer is not lifted.
• In the event that asphalt that is delaminated or exhibits evidence of delamination or lack of bond to the underlying layer is observed in the work area after texturing.
• All delaminated or debonded asphalt is profiled to a sufficient depth to remove all delaminated or poorly bonded asphalt.
5.01 - Removal of asphalt from existing asphalt surfacing by milling to required depth.
• At the completion of milling in each work period and prior to the application of tack coat and asphalt paving.
• Prior notice (60 minutes minimum) of inspection to be given to the Contract Administrator.
• Depth of asphalt removed not less than depth shown on Drawings and not more than depth shown on Drawings plus 10 mm.
5.02 - Removal of asphalt from existing asphalt surface by milling to achieve a uniform surface.
• At the completion of milling in each work period and prior to the application of tack coat and asphalt paving.
• Prior notice (60 minutes minimum) of inspection to be given to the Contract Administrator.
• Surface is uniform, continuous without steps or abrupt changes in grade except at steps and edges of work, and free draining.
• There are no visible grooves and all existing pavement markings have been completely removed.
5.03 - Removal of asphalt from existing asphalt surface to produce neat cut edges.
• At the completion of milling in each work period and prior to the application of tack coat and asphalt paving.
• Prior notice (60 minutes minimum) of inspection to be given to the Contract Administrator.
Acceptance Criteria: Edges of cut are clean, not frayed and asphalt layer is not lifted.
• In the event that asphalt that is delaminated or exhibits evidence of delamination or lack of bond to the underlying layer is observed in the work area after texturing.
• All delaminated or debonded asphalt is milled to a sufficient depth to remove all delaminated or poorly bonded asphalt.
6.01 - Commencement of cleaning of cold planed surfaces
• At the commencement of cleaning of cold planed surfaces in each work period. Prior notice (30 minutes minimum) of commencement of cleaning to be given to the Contract Administrator.
Acceptance Criteria: Witness the cleaning of the entire cold planed surface of asphalt.
Frequency: At the completion of cleaning of cold planed surfaces.
• Cold planed surface is free from all loose material; excess dust, water or slurry; and pieces of milled asphalt.
• Cutting residue fully removed from the recesses in the surface, in corners and at the edges of the cut.
• Areas of oil or fuel spillage cleaned with detergent, flushed with water and dried.
• Progressively as cold planing work is completed in the work period.
• Prior notice (30 minutes minimum) of commencement of survey to be given to the Contract Administrator.
• Compacted thickness of asphalt at each survey grid point location is calculated and inputted into computer controlled thickness control device on the asphalt spreader.
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
